There is an easier way: Don't access them at all. ;-)

The default answer regarding privates and testing:
You should not need to access private members during a test, since
testing goes through the public interface.
If there are too many functions, that are private, but should be
tested, then maybe they belong into their own class an be public
there.

But if you do need to access private members, I don't know of any
other way then to use reflection.

Wait: In the back of my head I remember a project that had a feature
that one can access privates just normally from tests. I don't
remember the project, though... And I can't find a link in my
bookmarks either. Anyone any ideas?
